name: Marriott Portsmouth

reviews.text: Great location, with very modern rooms.
reviews.title: Nearly excellent
Disappointing Reception
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice with work, and really enjoyed my stays.
I would give it 5 stars, if not for a couple of niggles. Avoid any of the rooms that over look the noisy industrial fans, which I think are above the kitchen or the swimming pool.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent staff, great location would go back any time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last time I stayed, one the beds in the room had lipstick stains on the clean bedding. I should have complained, but it was late and I had already unpacked. So I just swapped into the other double bed.
reviews.title: Pleasant, relaxing atmosphere

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning is excellent.
reviews.title: Perfect Family hotel for a Peppa Pig break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went there for our anniversary and the staff there made us feel really special. Fruit and a card on arrival and then our table was decorated and another card at dinner. Two staff deserve a really special mention David the sommelier and Jasmine in the Sealevel restaurant. David is extremely knowledgeable about wines and spirits adn makes amazing cocktails! Jasmine is so friendly and helpful. These two really made our stary even going to the trouble to decorate our table and get us an anniversary card. Food here is great we ate there both evenings and had great food both times. Breakfast again very good. Rooms are clean and spacious and we had no trouble at all with noise even though there was a wedding and a birthday part on the same night. We will definately be going back again very soon
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always the hotel was beautifully clean, the staff were attentive & efficient. We stayed over night as we were attending a wedding at the hotel. My only negatives are the function rooms never have the air conditioning on, if in deed they have it in the function rooms.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, not our first & not our last stay!

reviews.text: The room was clean, and stylish, we were as requested on the top floor and we had no problem with noise from the rest of the hotel. The breakfast was of great quality and well organized. We have been to this hotel numerous times and yet again we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Never again - the staff have no control over guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed before a very early start for the ferries, and thought the Marriott would offer an excellent night's sleep before a long drive through France. The hotel looked great on arrival, though the staggering cameraman (at 5pm) coming through the revolving doors should have tipped us off. There was a wedding going on in the lobby and function rooms, and the guests were screaming and drunk all night, till 4am when the police arrived to break up a fight in the car park. Yes, you expect some noise as people return to their cars after the wedding, but there were groups outside having hour long screeching conversations, and the staff did nothing to quiet any of the guests down. I slept between 4-5am and that was it. A similarly shattered looking family were having an argument with the reception desk as we checked out, and we have vowed never to return again!
reviews.title: REALLY VERY GOOD!

reviews.text: I stayed here about three years ago and the hotel has improved hugely since then.
reviews.title: Great service located outside city

reviews.text: Marriot Portsmouth is a great stop-over before taking the ferry to France or receiving visitors from France. Its a great place to relax and unwind as you visit places in the Portsmouth area. There are a lot of places to visit like the Mary Rose, HMS Victory and the HMS Warrior. The new Gunwharf Quays with Pubs and Restaurants are awesome. Home of Charles Dickens and the Spinnaker Tower. Jamie Oliver's restauraunt and the Raymond Blanc Brasserie are in the Gunwharf Quays. Great place to stay.
reviews.title: Best place before taking the Ferry

reviews.text: I travel quite a bit, both on my own for business and with my family, and I've never had such a terrible night's sleep in a hotel, and by way of qualification this includes several trips made chaperoning students.
reviews.title: A cliché but: the worst night I've ever spent in a hotel!

reviews.text: There were loud guests; a very drunken wedding, which happens; but the staff did nothing. Which is unacceptable. Singing, footy chants, improvised re-enactments of trashy soap operas (well that's what it sounded like), motor bikes racing, couples breaking up, kids using the rotating doors as a playground: all in the middle of the night. All without an intervention from the staff (even when complaints were made).
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't go here. Go to the Premier Inn next door, which is excellent and competently managed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: After a seven hour drive this was a great place to stay prior to a crack of dawn start for the ferry to France. Rooms are a good size, well decorated, and wll looked after. Leisure facilities the ideal way to unwind after a dy in the car. No problems checking out at 5.45 the next morning either.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in, check out, room and bed all great. Didn't use the facilities so can't comment on those. However very unimpressed with the breakfast service- the tables were very slow to be cleared, mess everywhere. Staff cleared tables by brushing crumbs onto the floor! There seemed to be a lack of staff and you really struggled to get a coffee/tea, not the standard we usually get in a Marriott. Food itself was good. Also not happy that it cost £9.30 to have two strong latte coffees at the bar one evening!!!Ridiculous price!
reviews.title: our least favourite MARRIOTT hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located just off the motorway giving access in and out of town.
reviews.title: Cool bar area

reviews.text: The bar and restaurant area appears to have has a recent makeover as they had a cool and modern feel. We only slept in the hotel and didn’t use any of its facilities so difficult to make further comments.
reviews.title: Efficient branded hotel in indifferent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott in Portsmouth is well situated if you are a business traveller working perhaps in nearby IBM, or poorly situated if you are a vistor to Portsmouth's attractions such as the Dockyard. However, once inside, it is a friendly and efficient example of the brand, with a smart and modern public area, a small pool/gym and pleasant and bright rooms. As you might expect from hotels of this genre, drinks and food feel overpriced and although the room service food didn't arrive as billed on two occasions, it was at least of good quality. Lots of parking. Friendly staff (although they did seem thinly stretched over the weekend) and notably good bedding and pillows.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Friendly town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property was a family oriented property away from town. Has an indoor pool so a lot of families were vacationing with their small children. It is situated in an office park and near a large Tesco. Not much is in walking distance from the hotel so plan on using the transit system if you don't have a car. The town of Portsmouth is friendly and scenic and would go there again in a flash.
reviews.title: not your regular Marriott

description: Discover the Marriott hotel in Portsmouth, UK, providing easy access to major routes and airports, a convenient location near popular sights, like the Port Solent Marina,Spinnaker Tower, Gunwharf Quays Outlet shopping and historic Naval Dockyard. The hotel offers an ideal setting that makes business trips successful and leisure travel a pleasure. Sample the exciting, fresh flavors of our new Sealevel Restaurant or relax with a Starbucks coffee in our Sealevel Lounge. You can stay fit in our health club or dip into the refreshing indoor pool. And when planning a business or social event, you'll find 785 square meters of impressive Portsmouth, UK, hotel function space, complemented by expert catering and audiovisual services, ample parking and welcoming staff. The greenest hotel in Portsmouth, UK, has been transformed with the completion of its meeting, bedroom and leisure renovations. Enjoy stylish, spacious guest rooms offering a sleek and contemporary space to relax and recharge, with plush bedding and high-speed wireless Internet access.
